title: Ticket #4206: Reduce unused memory in DaemonCore data structures
description:
The DaemonCore code wastes some memory in its data structures for callback handlers registered for various events. It uses unnecessarily large static arrays of structs with noticeable internal fragmentation. The amount of wasted memory is minor in most cases, but adds up quickly on a submit machine with a large number of shadow processes.

Code for this ticket is committed on the branch V8_1-gt4206-daemoncore_diet.

Most of event handler structs (CommandEnt, SignalEnt, SockEnt, PipeEnt, ReapEnt) are laid out inefficiently, leading to a lot of internal fragmentation. Their elements can be reordered to decrease the overall size of the struct.

The event handler arrays comTable, sigTable, and reapTable are statically allocated with many more entries than required. They can be changed to dynamically-extendable arrays that start at a small size.

Some additional changes to consider:

  • Use StringSpace to store handler description strings. These are usually strdup()'d from static strings and many handlers may have the same description.
  • Collapse the handler and handlercpp elements into a union, since both aren't used at the same time.
  • Control the size of the ExtArrays more tightly. The default is to double the size when they need to be expanded. Trade-off of space vs. process startup time.
  • Keep the arrays comTable, sigTable, and reapTable sorted by the num element, allowing faster lookup.
